alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Windsor County through 245 PM EDT... At 153 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chester, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Springfield, Perkinsville Village, Baltimore, Weathersfield, Andover, Weathersfield Bow, West Springfield, North Chester, North Springfield Lake Recreation Area, North Springfield, Simonsville, Wilgus State Park and Gassetts. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 40 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
